alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 14 at 9:25AM PST until further notice by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, San Luis Obispo. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor urban flooding as well as minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 920 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate rain falling across the area. Hourly rainfall rates of one quarter inch or less have been observed with local rates up to four tenths of an inch per hour. This will cause minor urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Luis Obispo, Paso Robles, Morro Bay, Pismo Beach, Atascadero, Arroyo Grande, Cambria, Point Piedras Blancas, Cuyama, Grover Beach, Guadalupe, Santa Margarita, Shandon, Templeton and Oceano. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
